title: How to Make Your Home a Warm Place to Be

steps.headline: Keep it clean.
steps.description: The very first step towards making anyone feel comfortable is a clean home! Make sure the floor is clear of all clothing, misc objects, and trash. Clear the kitchen sink of dishes, empty trash cans, etc. Everything should have a place and everything should be in its place.

steps.headline: Make sure that there is nothing that will cause personal discomfort for your guests.
steps.description: Your home should reflect you, but please make sure there are no obscene or extremely odd statues, pictures, etc around. You don't want to make your guest feel uncomfortable just being or even looking around your home.

steps.headline: If you have a guest room, make sure there are ample sheets, blankets, and pillows available and in easy reach.
steps.description: The same goes if you have a pull out couch/bed. You want your guest to be as comfortable as possible if they are staying the night.

steps.headline: Supply toiletries such as toothpaste, toilet paper, towels, and wash rags.
steps.description: These are important and make your guest feel welcome.

steps.headline: Although they may be a guest, give them plenty of time to adjust to being in your home.
steps.description: Let them explore their surroundings and get settled in, but do not forget to give them a guided tour first!

steps.headline: Always make sure your guest is offered something to drink after about 20 - 30 minutes of entering your home.
steps.description: If they come in the evening or from a long flight/ride, offer dinner. You never want hungry guests! Always ask what THEY want to eat.

steps.headline: If they are staying the night, be sure you make him/her breakfast in the morning BEFORE they get up!
steps.description: Try to cook something a little more extravagant than what you would normally make for yourself. They should have an array of options to choose from. If you don't know what they like, ask!

steps.headline: Keep the temperature of your house or apartment at a comfortable 72 degrees.
If you have any pets that may be aggressive or noisy, keep them away from guests.
steps.description: Also, make sure they are not allergic to any types of pets before you invite them in your home!

text: Keep it clean. The very first step towards making anyone feel comfortable is a clean home! Make sure the floor is clear of all clothing, misc objects, and trash. Clear the kitchen sink of dishes, empty trash cans, etc. Everything should have a place and everything should be in its place. Make sure that there is nothing that will cause personal discomfort for your guests. Your home should reflect you, but please make sure there are no obscene or extremely odd statues, pictures, etc around. You don't want to make your guest feel uncomfortable just being or even looking around your home. If you have a guest room, make sure there are ample sheets, blankets, and pillows available and in easy reach. The same goes if you have a pull out couch/bed. You want your guest to be as comfortable as possible if they are staying the night. Supply toiletries such as toothpaste, toilet paper, towels, and wash rags. These are important and make your guest feel welcome. Although they may be a guest, give them plenty of time to adjust to being in your home. Let them explore their surroundings and get settled in, but do not forget to give them a guided tour first! Always make sure your guest is offered something to drink after about 20 - 30 minutes of entering your home. If they come in the evening or from a long flight/ride, offer dinner. You never want hungry guests! Always ask what THEY want to eat. If they are staying the night, be sure you make him/her breakfast in the morning BEFORE they get up! Try to cook something a little more extravagant than what you would normally make for yourself. They should have an array of options to choose from. If you don't know what they like, ask! Keep the temperature of your house or apartment at a comfortable 72 degrees. Unless your guests request otherwise! If you have any pets that may be aggressive or noisy, keep them away from guests. Also, make sure they are not allergic to any types of pets before you invite them in your home!
